name: Brooklyn Banks
description: Legendary brick banks under the Brooklyn Bridge on-ramp. One of the most iconic skate spots in history. The angled brick embankments provide perfect natural transitions for wallrides, bank tricks, and creative lines.
features: banks, ledges, manual pads, stairs

name: Tompkins Square Park
description: Classic East Village park with a longstanding skate-friendly culture. Smooth paths, varied ledge heights, and a welcoming atmosphere make it accessible for all skill levels.
features: flat ground, benches, manual pads, curbs

name: LES Skatepark
description: Official concrete skatepark under the Manhattan Bridge. A well-designed mix of street and transition elements that serves as one of Manhattan's primary skateparks.
features: bowl, quarter pipes, ledges, rails, flat bars

name: Chelsea Piers Skatepark
description: Indoor/covered skatepark at Chelsea Piers sports complex along the Hudson River.
features: mini ramp, quarter pipes, rails, ledges

name: Astor Place
description: Iconic NYC plaza with the Alamo cube sculpture. Smooth ground and skateable ledges.
features: flat ground, ledges, marble benches, manual pads

name: Federal Plaza
description: Massive government plaza with perfect granite ledges. Heavily skated in videos but security is aggressive.
features: granite ledges, flat ground, stairs, gaps

name: Owl's Head Skatepark
description: Well-built concrete skatepark in Owl's Head Park with harbor views. One of Brooklyn's best skateparks featuring both transition and street elements.
features: bowl, snake run, ledges, rails, quarter pipes

name: McCarren Skatepark
description: Popular Williamsburg skatepark in McCarren Park. Great street-style layout.
features: ledges, rails, flat bars, manual pads, quarter pipes

name: DUMBO Skate Spot
description: Cobblestone-adjacent flat areas under the Manhattan Bridge in DUMBO with various skateable architecture.
features: ledges, flat ground, banks, curbs

name: Prospect Park Skate Circle
description: Smooth park loops and the skate circle area near the bandshell. Great for cruising and flat ground tricks.
features: flat ground, smooth paths, gentle slopes

name: Flushing Meadows Skatepark
description: Large concrete skatepark in Flushing Meadows Corona Park near the Unisphere.
features: bowl, rails, ledges, quarter pipes, stairs

name: Rockaway Beach Skatepark
description: Beachside bowl-heavy park with deep transition. One of the gnarliest parks in NYC.
features: bowl, snake run, pool coping, deep end, extensions

name: Astoria Park Skatepark
description: Solid neighborhood skatepark under the Hell Gate Bridge in Astoria Park.
features: ledges, rails, quarter pipes, manual pads

name: Mullaly Skatepark
description: One of the best skateparks in NYC. Deep bowls with excellent flow, a quality street section, and top-tier concrete work. The Bronx's crown jewel of skating.
features: bowl, pool coping, spine, hips, deep transitions, street section

name: River Park Skatepark
description: Neighborhood park along the Bronx River with a compact but fun skate area.
features: ledges, rails, quarter pipes, flat bars

name: Stapleton Skatepark
description: Staten Island's primary skatepark near the waterfront. Compact street-style layout.
features: ledges, rails, quarter pipes, manual pads, flat bars

name: Pier 62 Skatepark
description: Free public skatepark on Pier 62 in Hudson River Park. Great river views and solid design.
features: bowl, ledges, rails, stairs, banks, flat bars

name: Cooper Park Skatepark
description: Neighborhood skatepark in Cooper Park. Small but well-maintained with a friendly local scene.
features: ledges, rails, quarter pipes, manual pads

name: Washington Heights Banks
description: Steep streets and concrete banks in the Heights. Raw street skating with amazing hill bombs.
features: banks, ledges, stairs, gaps

name: Red Hook DIY Spot
description: Community-built DIY spot in Red Hook's industrial waterfront area. Raw, creative, and constantly evolving.
features: DIY ramps, concrete transitions, ledges, creative obstacles

name: Midtown Courthouse Banks
description: Marble banks and ledges around Midtown courthouses. Classic spot but heavy security.
features: banks, ledges, flat ground, stairs

name: Hunts Point DIY
description: Bronx DIY spot built by local skaters in Hunts Point industrial area. Gritty and authentic.
features: DIY ramps, flat bars, manual pads, creative features

name: Freshkills Skatepark
description: Modern skatepark built on the transformed Freshkills landfill site. Clean concrete with a mix of transition and street features.
features: bowl, rails, quarter pipes, manual pad

name: Faber Park Banks
description: Mellow banks and smooth ledges in a quiet park setting. Low-key spot that rarely gets crowded.
features: banks, ledges, flat ground

name: Midland Beach Skatepark
description: Beachside skatepark with ocean breezes and a solid mix of street and transition elements.
features: mini ramp, rails, hubba, pyramid

name: South Beach DIY
description: Gritty DIY spot under the expressway overpass. Raw concrete and creative obstacles built by locals.
features: DIY quarter pipe, bank-to-wall, jersey barriers, flat bars

name: Maloof Skatepark
description: World-class skatepark designed by California Skateparks. Deep bowl, flowing snake run, and technical street section.
features: bowl, snake run, ledges, stairs, handrails

name: Far Rockaway Skatepark
description: Beachfront skatepark steps from the Atlantic Ocean. Chill vibes with a good mix of features for all levels.
features: mini ramp, fun box, rails, manual pad, quarter pipe

name: Pelham Bay Skatepark
description: Solid neighborhood park near Pelham Bay Park with a good flow layout and smooth concrete.
features: bowl, rails, ledges, bank, pyramid

name: Poe Park Banks
description: Natural banks and granite ledges in the park surrounding the Edgar Allan Poe Cottage. Smooth ground for flatground tricks.
features: banks, ledges, stairs, flat ground

name: Riverside Skatepark
description: Riverside Park's hidden gem — a well-maintained skatepark overlooking the Hudson River.
features: bowl, mini ramp, ledges, flat bars, bank

name: Coleman Playground Skatepark
description: Uptown skatepark in Washington Heights with a tight but fun layout. Strong local scene.
features: mini ramp, quarter pipe, ledges, manual pad

name: Columbus Park Benches
description: Smooth marble benches and granite ledges in the heart of Chinatown. Classic NYC street skating.
features: benches, ledges, flat ground, manual pads

name: Harlem River Park Banks
description: Steep banks along the Harlem River with raw street spots scattered throughout. Not for beginners.
features: banks, ledges, gaps, stairs

name: Industry City Banks
description: Repurposed industrial complex with butter-smooth ground, mellow banks, and endless ledge lines.
features: banks, ledges, smooth ground, loading docks

name: Greenpoint Skatepark
description: Compact but well-designed park in the heart of Greenpoint. Strong local scene and good vibes.
features: bowl, mini ramp, rails, hubba, flat bar

name: Bed-Stuy DIY Spot
description: Community-built DIY spot under the J/M tracks. Raw, creative, and constantly evolving.
features: DIY quarter pipe, bank, flat bar, manual pad, jersey barriers

name: Coney Island Skatepark
description: Boardwalk-adjacent skatepark with ocean views. Skate, then hit the beach or grab a Nathan's dog.
features: bowl, mini ramp, rails, ledges, fun box

name: The Cube (Astor Place)
description: The iconic Alamo cube sculpture plaza — ultra-smooth ground perfect for flatground sessions and filming.
features: flat ground, manual pads, benches

name: Bronx River Skatepark
description: Spacious skatepark along the Bronx River Greenway. Room to ride with a diverse set of features.
features: bowl, rails, quarter pipe, pyramid, ledges

name: Springfield Park Spot
description: Southeast Queens hidden gem with smooth ledges and natural banks throughout the park.
features: ledges, banks, stairs, flat ground

name: Williamsburg Bridge Banks
description: Raw street spot under the Williamsburg Bridge approach. Steep banks and crusty ledges — not for the faint of heart.
features: banks, ledges, gaps, rough ground

name: The OG Manhattan
description: Hit the most iconic Manhattan skate spots in one legendary day — from the Brooklyn Banks to Tompkins, through LES and finishing at Astor Place. This is the route every NYC skater should ride at least once.
features: brooklyn-banks, les-skatepark, tompkins-square-park, astor-place

name: Brooklyn Bridge to Banks
description: Cross the Brooklyn Bridge on your board, hit the Banks, then loop through downtown Manhattan's best street spots. Touristy? Maybe. Epic? Absolutely.
features: dumbo-spot, brooklyn-banks, federal-plaza

name: Williamsburg to Bushwick
description: Brooklyn's creative corridor — from McCarren Park's modern skatepark through the street art of Bushwick to the DIY energy of Cooper Park. This route is pure Brooklyn.
features: mccarren-skatepark, cooper-park, red-hook-diy

name: Queens Quest
description: Explore Queens' diverse skate scene — from Flushing Meadows' world-class park to the beachfront vibes of Rockaway. This borough has way more than people think.
features: flushing-meadows-skatepark, maloof-skatepark, far-rockaway-skatepark, rockaway-beach-skatepark

name: Beach Day
description: Sun, sand, and skateboarding — hit the coastal parks from Brooklyn to Queens. Pack sunscreen and a towel.
features: coney-island-skatepark, rockaway-beach-skatepark, far-rockaway-skatepark

name: Rainy Day Options
description: When it's pouring, you don't stop skating — you get creative. Hit the covered spots and DIY havens that work in the wet.
features: south-beach-diy, williamsburg-bridge-spot, bed-stuy-diy

name: The Full Borough Blitz
description: The ultimate NYC skate marathon — hit all five boroughs in one epic day. This is a full-day commitment and a badge of honor.
features: stapleton-skatepark, brooklyn-banks, mccarren-skatepark, flushing-meadows-skatepark, mullaly-skatepark

name: Culture & Kickflips
description: NYC isn't just about spots — it's about the culture around them. This route pairs great skate spots with museums, galleries, and cultural landmarks.
features: columbus-park-spot, federal-plaza, the-cube-astor, chelsea-piers-skatepark
